flawed_nl_solution:
If Pedro has 3 times more gumballs than Alicia, he has 3 * 20 gumballs = <<3*20=60>>60 gumballs more
In total, Pedro has 20 gumballs + 60 gumballs = <<20+60=80>>80 gumballs
When they put their gumballs together, the total number of gumballs in the bowl becomes 20 gumballs + 80 gumballs = <<20+80=100>>100 gumballs
Pedro takes out 40/100 of the gumballs which is 40/100 * 100 gumballs = <<40/100*100=500/2>>500/2 gumballs.
The number of gumballs remaining is 100 gumballs - 500/2 gumballs = <<100-500/2=-150>>-150 gumballs
#### -150

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 500/2. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
